title.text: Multi-Source Transformer for Kazakh-Russian-English Neural Machine Translation

abstractContent.text: We describe the neural machine translation (NMT) system developed at the National Research Council of Canada (NRC) for the Kazakh-English news translation task of the Fourth Conference on Machine Translation (WMT19).

entities.text: Kazakh-English news translation task of the Fourth Conference on Machine Translation (WMT19)

abstractContent.text: Our submission is a multi-source NMT system taking both the original Kazakh sentence and its Russian translation as input for translating into English.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: BLEU scores on WMT19 Kazakh-English news translation. en2kk denotes synthetic Kazakh back- translated from English. ru2kk denotes synthetic Kazakh cross-translated from Russian. en2ru denotes synthetic  Russian back-translated from English. kk2ru denotes synthetic Russian cross-translated from Kazakh. * denotes an  unofficial post-competition result, a fully-trained version of our top system, which had only been partially trained  due to time constraints.
Table 2: Automatic evaluation results for the top 5 con- strained systems in WMT19
Table 3: Human evaluation results for the top 5 con- strained systems in WMT19
